data.row: The flames cannot be "doused" by normal means.
Along the shore line, mixed into the sand, but far enough away from the battlements and walls so that they will not be set aflame accidentally.
The enormous force shown IN THE GOT EPISODE towards the end.
Acknowledgement of 's irrelevancy.
Rhetorical question.
Not "raw" numbers, but troops equipped and primed for a forward assault on a heavily defended castle gate and other initial defenses.

row.for: also landed at that other place

data.row: Further along shore; where they came from at the end of the GOT episode.
Acknowledgement of concession in .
Reaffirm concession in .
Preemptive clarafication (for further argument).
However much would be necessary. Very likely a small amount, similar to a gallon or so.
Rhetorical question.
Implying premises from and .

My best archers are atop the tallest towers of the battlements. Recall that King' Landing was a city built to withstand seige. Of course it has tall towers. Look at the opening if you want to see them. And if they are not atop those (too full or whatever), my archers can easily be positioned in such as way as to be able to reach out to where the ships were with their arrows, similar to what happened in GOT.

Humoring asserted point on assumption that "half of their troops" is referring to some sane number able to even fit on shore! Like Sparta, the door is only so big, and only so many rams can effectively ram it at the same time. Everyone else is just getting shot at by arrows.
Rhetorical question.

Obviously this means "more than they reinforced it in GOT". Their door was barely reinforced. They needed it to be this way so that they could quickly open and close it. You can't do that with a few giant stone blocks in the way! Like in GOT, a sneak attack would obviously come from the sally port.
Acknowledgement of contradiction in (you'll see a lot of these acknowledgements, and they all begin with "um").
Counters contradiction in .
Local is laying the framework to repeat himself (a repeat of ).

The castle gate in GOT was NOT heavily barricaded. You CANNOT readily open and close a heavily barricaded gate. One wooden plank across the middle does not count as heavily barricaded in real life, or in GOT.
Tete-a-tete with .
Clarafication of strategy. Of course the gate wouldn't hold forever.

row.for: for a majority of their troops

data.row: Clarafication: A majority of their FORWARD attack troops. In siege warfare, you don't just send in your main army and expect to win. Your pawns go first to clear away the riff raff, get shot at, and open the gates for everyone else.
Not what will happen, but what the enemy WANTS to happen, and what they're banking on.
Acknowledgement of 's irrelevancy.
Humor anyway, for sake of argument.
Preparing to respond to .
Possibly a point of disconnection: did he forget just happened not two minutes ago?
Acknowledgement of remote's possible short term memory. Prepares to repeat self.

Tried to find previous text to copy and paste, but cannot find it fast enough. Decides to retype. Restated points do not count as "salient", although they are (should be) implicitly interpreted as such by the debators.
Humor with an absurdly large number.

Extrapolation. Local is sure there are "reserve" forward attackers still on some of the ships somewhere. The goal of the strategy is to lure as many of them onto the ground as possible. Reality check: knights and other heavily armored "main attack force" units are not good at climbing ladders and/or carrying rams.
Repeat of .
The soldiers in the sand, along with their rams, have all gone up in flames.
Repeat of .
The main massive army.
This gives me a good 15 to 30 minutes to essentially throw flames at the enemy's approaching warships.
Fire at the approaching warships.

The main massive army is now either directly in the water or in small unprotected life boats. Evacuation processes are a very messy panicked business. No heavy siege tech. Barely any rams. Barely any real weaponry. People confused. Going in the wrong directions. Random people shouting contradictory orders. AKA: sitting ducks while the shore fire dies down and local's archers knock some more arrows. BTW: heavily armored units (knights and the like) do not float all that well. Write that down.

Losing patience with these obvious contradictions of logic.
The defenders.

This is their "attempt".
Main battle-ready army. The real fighters, knights, heavily armored units, etc. Contrast that with a relatively fast lightly armored forward attack force.

Random assertion; circumnavigation of .
See: .
Preemptive clarafication attempt apropos .
Hypothetical acknowledged by all parties. Local assumes five rams can attack the door concurrently for the sake of argument.

A clarafication of the materials a typical ram is made of. Wood. I'm sure the siege ships would be made of the hardest, strongest wood availableâ€”similar in material to the rams themselves. Here, some wikipedia reality: "... a battering ram is just a large, heavy [wooden] log carried by several people and propelled with force against an obstacle ..."; as for the GOT ram, it was most definitely a Capped Ram, or "... a battering ram that has an accessory at the head ([the accessory] usually made of iron or steel and sometimes punningly shaped into the head and horns of an ovine ram) to do more damage to a building." Now, still trying to claim that "hard" wood can't be set on fire, hmm? We'll deal with that shortly.
What do we mean when we say greek fire (or wildfire or whatever)? Some ungodly cross between Napalm and Greek Fire. Looking for an effective countermeasure? Stay the FUCK out of range!
Request for clarafication. Met by .
Some veiled request for clarafication. Met by .
Implying there exists a strategy that suffers from "lack of variables"; this thread of thought is immediately dropped by its begetter due to its blatant irrelevancy.
Non-salient, non-cogent, no substance, no support.
Possible disconnect point: apparently and were forgotten already!
Clarafication of 's immense number, heads off a would-be contradiction.
Logical contradiction: did he miss the whole conversation? Why did we circle back here? The sand is on fire, says ! WTF?

Circumnavigation of point. Suppose a small forward assault force, similar to the remaining 100 at the end of GOT, make it through a broken castle gate... the MAIN ARMY and all of the heavy siege tech is STILL on fire and pretty much LOST AT SEA!
Contradiction of GOT. To be able to open and shut the door so quickly means it was lightly barricaded, at best... and STILL held its own against ram! Imagine quintupling that fortification attempt.

modal.data: Lol! "Hardwood" cannot be set on fire! Well, fuck fire retardant clothing and stuff... might as well just coat everything in wood. I'll definitely survive any fire!

Because he is obviously a master general major commander of strategy and, as such a god, his opinion reigns over all! No, what this is called is "I cannot win, but maybe he can, so please, try him instead".
